source: O*NET OnLine by U.S. Department of Labor, Employment and Training Administration. Licensed CC-BY 4.0.

skills.name: Reading Comprehension
skills.description: Understanding written sentences and paragraphs in work-related documents.

skills.name: Active Listening
skills.description: Giving full attention to what other people are saying, taking time to understand the points being made, asking questions as appropriate, and not interrupting at inappropriate times.

skills.name: Writing
skills.description: Communicating effectively in writing as appropriate for the needs of the audience.

skills.name: Speaking
skills.description: Talking to others to convey information effectively.

skills.name: Mathematics
skills.description: Using mathematics to solve problems.

skills.name: Science
skills.description: Using scientific rules and methods to solve problems.

skills.name: Critical Thinking
skills.description: Using logic and reasoning to identify the strengths and weaknesses of alternative solutions, conclusions, or approaches to problems.

skills.name: Active Learning
skills.description: Understanding the implications of new information for both current and future problem-solving and decision-making.

skills.name: Learning Strategies
skills.description: Selecting and using training/instructional methods and procedures appropriate for the situation when learning or teaching new things.

skills.name: Monitoring
skills.description: Assessing performance of yourself, other individuals, or organizations to make improvements or take corrective action.

skills.name: Complex Problem Solving
skills.description: Identifying complex problems and reviewing related information to develop and evaluate options and implement solutions.

skills.name: Management of Financial Resources
skills.description: Determining how money will be spent to get the work done, and accounting for these expenditures.

skills.name: Management of Material Resources
skills.description: Obtaining and seeing to the appropriate use of equipment, facilities, and materials needed to do certain work.

skills.name: Management of Personnel Resources
skills.description: Motivating, developing, and directing people as they work, identifying the best people for the job.

skills.name: Time Management
skills.description: Managing one's own time and the time of others.

skills.name: Coordination
skills.description: Adjusting actions in relation to others' actions.

skills.name: Instructing
skills.description: Teaching others how to do something.

skills.name: Negotiation
skills.description: Bringing others together and trying to reconcile differences.

skills.name: Persuasion
skills.description: Persuading others to change their minds or behavior.

skills.name: Service Orientation
skills.description: Actively looking for ways to help people.

skills.name: Social Perceptiveness
skills.description: Being aware of others' reactions and understanding why they react as they do.

skills.name: Judgment and Decision Making
skills.description: Considering the relative costs and benefits of potential actions to choose the most appropriate one.

skills.name: Systems Analysis
skills.description: Determining how a system should work and how changes in conditions, operations, and the environment will affect outcomes.

skills.name: Systems Evaluation
skills.description: Identifying measures or indicators of system performance and the actions needed to improve or correct performance, relative to the goals of the system.

skills.name: Equipment Maintenance
skills.description: Performing routine maintenance on equipment and determining when and what kind of maintenance is needed.

skills.name: Equipment Selection
skills.description: Determining the kind of tools and equipment needed to do a job.

skills.name: Installation
skills.description: Installing equipment, machines, wiring, or programs to meet specifications.

skills.name: Operation and Control
skills.description: Controlling operations of equipment or systems.

skills.name: Operations Analysis
skills.description: Analyzing needs and product requirements to create a design.

skills.name: Operations Monitoring
skills.description: Watching gauges, dials, or other indicators to make sure a machine is working properly.

skills.name: Programming
skills.description: Writing computer programs for various purposes.

skills.name: Quality Control Analysis
skills.description: Conducting tests and inspections of products, services, or processes to evaluate quality or performance.

skills.name: Repairing
skills.description: Repairing machines or systems using the needed tools.

skills.name: Technology Design
skills.description: Generating or adapting equipment and technology to serve user needs.

skills.name: Troubleshooting
skills.description: Determining causes of operating errors and deciding what to do about it.

skills.name: English Language
skills.description: Knowledge of the structure and content of the English language including the meaning and spelling of words, and rules of composition and grammar.

skills.name: Fine Arts
skills.description: Knowledge of the theory and techniques required to compose, produce, and perform works of music, dance, visual arts, drama, and sculpture.

skills.name: Foreign Language
skills.description: Knowledge of the structure and content of a foreign (non-English) language including the meaning and spelling of words, rules of composition and grammar, and pronunciation.

skills.name: History and Archeology
skills.description: Knowledge of historical events and their causes, indicators, and effects on civilizations and cultures.

skills.name: Philosophy and Theology
skills.description: Knowledge of different philosophical systems and religions. This includes their basic principles, values, ethics, ways of thinking, customs, practices, and their impact on human culture.

skills.name: Administration and Management
skills.description: Knowledge of business and management principles involved in strategic planning, resource allocation, human resources modeling, leadership technique, production methods, and coordination of people and resources.

skills.name: Administrative
skills.description: Knowledge of administrative and office procedures and systems such as word processing, managing files and records, stenography and transcription, designing forms, and workplace terminology.

skills.name: Customer and Personal Service
skills.description: Knowledge of principles and processes for providing customer and personal services. This includes customer needs assessment, meeting quality standards for services, and evaluation of customer satisfaction.

skills.name: Economics and Accounting
skills.description: Knowledge of economic and accounting principles and practices, the financial markets, banking, and the analysis and reporting of financial data.

skills.name: Personnel and Human Resources
skills.description: Knowledge of principles and procedures for personnel recruitment, selection, training, compensation and benefits, labor relations and negotiation, and personnel information systems.

skills.name: Sales and Marketing
skills.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for showing, promoting, and selling products or services. This includes marketing strategy and tactics, product demonstration, sales techniques, and sales control systems.

skills.name: Communications and Media
skills.description: Knowledge of media production, communication, and dissemination techniques and methods. This includes alternative ways to inform and entertain via written, oral, and visual media.

skills.name: Telecommunications
skills.description: Knowledge of transmission, broadcasting, switching, control, and operation of telecommunications systems.

skills.name: Education and Training
skills.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for curriculum and training design, teaching and instruction for individuals and groups, and the measurement of training effects.

skills.name: Building and Construction
skills.description: Knowledge of materials, methods, and the tools involved in the construction or repair of houses, buildings, or other structures such as highways and roads.

skills.name: Computers and Electronics
skills.description: Knowledge of circuit boards, processors, chips, electronic equipment, and computer hardware and software, including applications and programming.

skills.name: Design
skills.description: Knowledge of design techniques, tools, and principles involved in production of precision technical plans, blueprints, drawings, and models.

skills.name: Engineering and Technology
skills.description: Knowledge of the practical application of engineering science and technology. This includes applying principles, techniques, procedures, and equipment to the design and production of various goods and services.

skills.name: Mechanical
skills.description: Knowledge of machines and tools, including their designs, uses, repair, and maintenance.

skills.name: Medicine and Dentistry
skills.description: Knowledge of the information and techniques needed to diagnose and treat human injuries, diseases, and deformities. This includes symptoms, treatment alternatives, drug properties and interactions, and preventive health-care measures.

skills.name: Therapy and Counseling
skills.description: Knowledge of principles, methods, and procedures for diagnosis, treatment, and rehabilitation of physical and mental dysfunctions, and for career counseling and guidance.

skills.name: Law and Government
skills.description: Knowledge of laws, legal codes, court procedures, precedents, government regulations, executive orders, agency rules, and the democratic political process.

skills.name: Public Safety and Security
skills.description: Knowledge of relevant equipment, policies, procedures, and strategies to promote effective local, state, or national security operations for the protection of people, data, property, and institutions.

skills.name: Food Production
skills.description: Knowledge of techniques and equipment for planting, growing, and harvesting food products (both plant and animal) for consumption, including storage/handling techniques.

skills.name: Production and Processing
skills.description: Knowledge of raw materials, production processes, quality control, costs, and other techniques for maximizing the effective manufacture and distribution of goods.

skills.name: Biology
skills.description: Knowledge of plant and animal organisms, their tissues, cells, functions, interdependencies, and interactions with each other and the environment.

skills.name: Chemistry
skills.description: Knowledge of the chemical composition, structure, and properties of substances and of the chemical processes and transformations that they undergo. This includes uses of chemicals and their interactions, danger signs, production techniques, and disposal methods.

skills.name: Geography
skills.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for describing the features of land, sea, and air masses, including their physical characteristics, locations, interrelationships, and distribution of plant, animal, and human life.

skills.name: Physics
skills.description: Knowledge and prediction of physical principles, laws, their interrelationships, and applications to understanding fluid, material, and atmospheric dynamics, and mechanical, electrical, atomic and sub-atomic structures and processes.

skills.name: Psychology
skills.description: Knowledge of human behavior and performance; individual differences in ability, personality, and interests; learning and motivation; psychological research methods; and the assessment and treatment of behavioral and affective disorders.

skills.name: Sociology and Anthropology
skills.description: Knowledge of group behavior and dynamics, societal trends and influences, human migrations, ethnicity, cultures, and their history and origins.

skills.name: Transportation
skills.description: Knowledge of principles and methods for moving people or goods by air, rail, sea, or road, including the relative costs and benefits.

skills.name: Estimating the Quantifiable Characteristics of Products, Events, or Information
skills.description: Estimating sizes, distances, and quantities; or determining time, costs, resources, or materials needed to perform a work activity.

skills.name: Identifying Objects, Actions, and Events
skills.description: Identifying information by categorizing, estimating, recognizing differences or similarities, and detecting changes in circumstances or events.

skills.name: Inspecting Equipment, Structures, or Materials
skills.description: Inspecting equipment, structures, or materials to identify the cause of errors or other problems or defects.

skills.name: Getting Information
skills.description: Observing, receiving, and otherwise obtaining information from all relevant sources.

skills.name: Monitoring Processes, Materials, or Surroundings
skills.description: Monitoring and reviewing information from materials, events, or the environment, to detect or assess problems.

skills.name: Monitoring and Controlling Resources
skills.description: Monitoring and controlling resources and overseeing the spending of money.

skills.name: Performing Administrative Activities
skills.description: Performing day-to-day administrative tasks such as maintaining information files and processing paperwork.

skills.name: Staffing Organizational Units
skills.description: Recruiting, interviewing, selecting, hiring, and promoting employees in an organization.

skills.name: Assisting and Caring for Others
skills.description: Providing personal assistance, medical attention, emotional support, or other personal care to others such as coworkers, customers, or patients.

skills.name: Communicating with People Outside the Organization
skills.description: Communicating with people outside the organization, representing the organization to customers, the public, government, and other external sources.

skills.name: Communicating with Supervisors, Peers, or Subordinates
skills.description: Providing information to supervisors, co-workers, and subordinates by telephone, in written form, e-mail, or in person.

skills.name: Establishing and Maintaining Interpersonal Relationships
skills.description: Developing constructive and cooperative working relationships with others, and maintaining them over time.

skills.name: Interpreting the Meaning of Information for Others
skills.description: Translating or explaining what information means and how it can be used.

skills.name: Performing for or Working Directly with the Public
skills.description: Performing for people or dealing directly with the public. This includes serving customers in restaurants and stores, and receiving clients or guests.

skills.name: Resolving Conflicts and Negotiating with Others
skills.description: Handling complaints, settling disputes, and resolving grievances and conflicts, or otherwise negotiating with others.

skills.name: Selling or Influencing Others
skills.description: Convincing others to buy merchandise/goods or to otherwise change their minds or actions.

skills.name: Coaching and Developing Others
skills.description: Identifying the developmental needs of others and coaching, mentoring, or otherwise helping others to improve their knowledge or skills.

skills.name: Coordinating the Work and Activities of Others
skills.description: Getting members of a group to work together to accomplish tasks.

skills.name: Developing and Building Teams
skills.description: Encouraging and building mutual trust, respect, and cooperation among team members.

skills.name: Guiding, Directing, and Motivating Subordinates
skills.description: Providing guidance and direction to subordinates, including setting performance standards and monitoring performance.

skills.name: Providing Consultation and Advice to Others
skills.description: Providing guidance and expert advice to management or other groups on technical, systems-, or process-related topics.

skills.name: Training and Teaching Others
skills.description: Identifying the educational needs of others, developing formal educational or training programs or classes, and teaching or instructing others.

skills.name: Analyzing Data or Information
skills.description: Identifying the underlying principles, reasons, or facts of information by breaking down information or data into separate parts.

skills.name: Evaluating Information to Determine Compliance with Standards
skills.description: Using relevant information and individual judgment to determine whether events or processes comply with laws, regulations, or standards.

skills.name: Judging the Qualities of Objects, Services, or People
skills.description: Assessing the value, importance, or quality of things or people.

skills.name: Processing Information
skills.description: Compiling, coding, categorizing, calculating, tabulating, auditing, or verifying information or data.

skills.name: Developing Objectives and Strategies
skills.description: Establishing long-range objectives and specifying the strategies and actions to achieve them.

skills.name: Making Decisions and Solving Problems
skills.description: Analyzing information and evaluating results to choose the best solution and solve problems.

skills.name: Organizing, Planning, and Prioritizing Work
skills.description: Developing specific goals and plans to prioritize, organize, and accomplish your work.

skills.name: Scheduling Work and Activities
skills.description: Scheduling events, programs, and activities, as well as the work of others.

skills.name: Thinking Creatively
skills.description: Developing, designing, or creating new applications, ideas, relationships, systems, or products, including artistic contributions.

skills.name: Updating and Using Relevant Knowledge
skills.description: Keeping up-to-date technically and applying new knowledge to your job.

skills.name: Documenting/Recording Information
skills.description: Entering, transcribing, recording, storing, or maintaining information in written or electronic/magnetic form.

skills.name: Drafting, Laying Out, and Specifying Technical Devices, Parts, and Equipment
skills.description: Providing documentation, detailed instructions, drawings, or specifications to tell others about how devices, parts, equipment, or structures are to be fabricated, constructed, assembled, modified, maintained, or used.

skills.name: Repairing and Maintaining Electronic Equipment
skills.description: Servicing, repairing, calibrating, regulating, fine-tuning, or testing machines, devices, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of electrical or electronic (not mechanical) principles.

skills.name: Repairing and Maintaining Mechanical Equipment
skills.description: Servicing, repairing, adjusting, and testing machines, devices, moving parts, and equipment that operate primarily on the basis of mechanical (not electronic) principles.

skills.name: Working with Computers
skills.description: Using computers and computer systems (including hardware and software) to program, write software, set up functions, enter data, or process information.

skills.name: Controlling Machines and Processes
skills.description: Using either control mechanisms or direct physical activity to operate machines or processes (not including computers or vehicles).

skills.name: Handling and Moving Objects
skills.description: Using hands and arms in handling, installing, positioning, and moving materials, and manipulating things.

skills.name: Operating Vehicles, Mechanized Devices, or Equipment
skills.description: Running, maneuvering, navigating, or driving vehicles or mechanized equipment, such as forklifts, passenger vehicles, aircraft, or watercraft.

skills.name: Performing General Physical Activities
skills.description: Performing general physical activities includes doing activities that require considerable use of your arms and legs and moving your whole body, such as climbing, lifting, balancing, walking, stooping, and handling materials.

skills.name: Attention to Detail
skills.description: A tendency to be detail-oriented, organized, and thorough in completing work.

skills.name: Cautiousness
skills.description: A tendency to be careful, deliberate, and risk-avoidant when making work-related decisions or doing work.

skills.name: Dependability
skills.description: A tendency to be reliable, responsible, and consistent in meeting work-related obligations.

skills.name: Integrity
skills.description: A tendency to be honest and ethical at work.

skills.name: Self-Control
skills.description: A tendency to remain calm and composed and to manage emotions effectively in response to criticism or difficult situations at work.

skills.name: Stress Tolerance
skills.description: A tendency to cope and function effectively in stressful situations at work.

skills.name: Cooperation
skills.description: A tendency to be pleasant, helpful, and willing to assist others at work.

skills.name: Empathy
skills.description: A tendency to show concern for others and be sensitive to others' needs and feelings at work.

skills.name: Humility
skills.description: A tendency to be modest and humble when interacting with others at work.

skills.name: Optimism
skills.description: A tendency to exhibit a positive attitude and positive emotions at work, even under difficult circumstances.

skills.name: Sincerity
skills.description: A tendency to be genuine and sincere in interactions with others at work, without concern for personal gain or self-interest.

skills.name: Social Orientation
skills.description: A tendency to seek out, enjoy, and be energized by social interaction at work.

skills.name: Achievement Orientation
skills.description: A tendency to establish and maintain personally challenging work-related goals, set high work-related standards, and exert high effort toward meeting those goals and standards.

skills.name: Adaptability
skills.description: A tendency to be open to and comfortable with change, new experiences, or ideas at work.

skills.name: Initiative
skills.description: A tendency to be proactive and take on extra responsibilities and tasks that may fall outside of one's required work role.

skills.name: Innovation
skills.description: A tendency to be inventive, to be imaginative, and to adopt new perspectives on ways to accomplish work.

skills.name: Intellectual Curiosity
skills.description: A tendency to seek out and acquire new work-related knowledge and obtain a deep understanding of work-related subjects.

skills.name: Leadership Orientation
skills.description: A tendency to lead, take charge, offer opinions, and provide direction at work.

skills.name: Perseverance
skills.description: A tendency to exhibit determination and resolve to perform or complete tasks in the face of difficult circumstances or obstacles at work.

skills.name: Self-Confidence
skills.description: A tendency to believe in one's work-related capabilities and ability to control one's work-related outcomes.

skills.name: Tolerance for Ambiguity
skills.description: A tendency to be comfortable with ambiguity and uncertainty at work.

skills.name: Selective Attention
skills.description: The ability to concentrate on a task over a period of time without being distracted.

skills.name: Time Sharing
skills.description: The ability to shift back and forth between two or more activities or sources of information.

skills.name: Category Flexibility
skills.description: The ability to generate or use different sets of rules for combining or grouping things in different ways.

skills.name: Deductive Reasoning
skills.description: The ability to apply general rules to specific problems to produce answers that make sense.

skills.name: Fluency of Ideas
skills.description: The ability to come up with a number of ideas about a topic (the number of ideas is important, not their quality, correctness, or creativity).

skills.name: Inductive Reasoning
skills.description: The ability to combine pieces of information to form general rules or conclusions (includes finding a relationship among seemingly unrelated events).

skills.name: Information Ordering
skills.description: The ability to arrange things or actions in a certain order or pattern according to a specific rule or set of rules.

skills.name: Originality
skills.description: The ability to come up with unusual or clever ideas about a given topic or situation, or to develop creative ways to solve a problem.

skills.name: Problem Sensitivity
skills.description: The ability to tell when something is wrong or is likely to go wrong. It does not involve solving the problem, only recognizing that there is a problem.

skills.name: Memorization
skills.description: The ability to remember information such as words, numbers, pictures, and procedures.

skills.name: Flexibility of Closure
skills.description: The ability to identify or detect a known pattern (a figure, object, word, or sound) that is hidden in other distracting material.

skills.name: Perceptual Speed
skills.description: The ability to quickly and accurately compare similarities and differences among sets of letters, numbers, objects, pictures, or patterns.

skills.name: Speed of Closure
skills.description: The ability to quickly make sense of, combine, and organize information into meaningful patterns.

skills.name: Mathematical Reasoning
skills.description: The ability to choose the right mathematical methods or formulas to solve a problem.

skills.name: Number Facility
skills.description: The ability to add, subtract, multiply, or divide quickly and correctly.

skills.name: Spatial Orientation
skills.description: The ability to know your location in relation to the environment or to know where other objects are in relation to you.

skills.name: Visualization
skills.description: The ability to imagine how something will look after it is moved around or when its parts are moved or rearranged.

skills.name: Oral Comprehension
skills.description: The ability to listen to and understand information and ideas presented through spoken words and sentences.

skills.name: Oral Expression
skills.description: The ability to communicate information and ideas in speaking so others will understand.

skills.name: Written Comprehension
skills.description: The ability to read and understand information and ideas presented in writing.

skills.name: Written Expression
skills.description: The ability to communicate information and ideas in writing so others will understand.

skills.name: Stamina
skills.description: The ability to exert yourself physically over long periods of time without getting winded or out of breath.

skills.name: Dynamic Flexibility
skills.description: The ability to quickly and repeatedly bend, stretch, twist, or reach out with your body, arms, and/or legs.

skills.name: Extent Flexibility
skills.description: The ability to bend, stretch, twist, or reach with your body, arms, and/or legs.

skills.name: Gross Body Coordination
skills.description: The ability to coordinate the movement of your arms, legs, and torso together when the whole body is in motion.

skills.name: Gross Body Equilibrium
skills.description: The ability to keep or regain your body balance or stay upright when in an unstable position.

skills.name: Dynamic Strength
skills.description: The ability to exert muscle force repeatedly or continuously over time. This involves muscular endurance and resistance to muscle fatigue.

skills.name: Explosive Strength
skills.description: The ability to use short bursts of muscle force to propel oneself (as in jumping or sprinting), or to throw an object.

skills.name: Static Strength
skills.description: The ability to exert maximum muscle force to lift, push, pull, or carry objects.

skills.name: Trunk Strength
skills.description: The ability to use your abdominal and lower back muscles to support part of the body repeatedly or continuously over time without giving out or fatiguing.

skills.name: Control Precision
skills.description: The ability to quickly and repeatedly adjust the controls of a machine or a vehicle to exact positions.

skills.name: Multilimb Coordination
skills.description: The ability to coordinate two or more limbs while sitting, standing, or lying down.

skills.name: Rate Control
skills.description: The ability to time your movements or the movement of a piece of equipment in anticipation of changes in the speed and/or direction of a moving object or scene.

skills.name: Response Orientation
skills.description: The ability to choose quickly between two or more movements in response to two or more different signals (lights, sounds, pictures).

skills.name: Arm-Hand Steadiness
skills.description: The ability to keep your hand and arm steady while moving your arm or while holding your arm and hand in one position.

skills.name: Finger Dexterity
skills.description: The ability to make precisely coordinated movements of the fingers of one or both hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble very small objects.

skills.name: Manual Dexterity
skills.description: The ability to quickly move your hand, your hand together with your arm, or your two hands to grasp, manipulate, or assemble objects.

skills.name: Reaction Time
skills.description: The ability to quickly respond (with the hand, finger, or foot) to a signal (sound, light, picture) when it appears.

skills.name: Speed of Limb Movement
skills.description: The ability to quickly move the arms and legs.

skills.name: Wrist-Finger Speed
skills.description: The ability to make fast, simple, repeated movements of the fingers, hands, and wrists.

skills.name: Auditory Attention
skills.description: The ability to focus on a single source of sound in the presence of other distracting sounds.

skills.name: Hearing Sensitivity
skills.description: The ability to detect or tell the differences between sounds that vary in pitch and loudness.

skills.name: Sound Localization
skills.description: The ability to tell the direction from which a sound originated.

skills.name: Speech Clarity
skills.description: The ability to speak clearly so others can understand you.

skills.name: Speech Recognition
skills.description: The ability to identify and understand the speech of another person.

skills.name: Depth Perception
skills.description: The ability to judge which of several objects is closer or farther away from you, or to judge the distance between you and an object.

skills.name: Far Vision
skills.description: The ability to see details at a distance.

skills.name: Glare Sensitivity
skills.description: The ability to see objects in the presence of a glare or bright lighting.

skills.name: Near Vision
skills.description: The ability to see details at close range (within a few feet of the observer).

skills.name: Night Vision
skills.description: The ability to see under low-light conditions.

skills.name: Peripheral Vision
skills.description: The ability to see objects or movement of objects to one's side when the eyes are looking ahead.

skills.name: Visual Color Discrimination
skills.description: The ability to match or detect differences between colors, including shades of color and brightness.
